extendedIngredients.name: smoked trout
extendedIngredients.original: 5 ozs smoked trout, skin and bones removed
extendedIngredients.originalName: smoked trout, skin and bones removed

title: Smoked-trout Pate
summary: The recipe Smoked-trout Pate could satisfy your Mediterranean craving in approximately 2 minutes. For $1.44 per serving, this recipe covers 8% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. Watching your figure? This pescatarian recipe has 180 calories, 10g of protein, and 9g of fat per serving. This recipe serves 6. 3 people have made this recipe and would make it again. It works well as a hor d'oeuvre. Head to the store and pick up trout, coarse salt, cottage cheese, and a few other things to make it today. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 41%. This score is pretty good. Similar recipes are Smoked Trout Pate, Smoked Trout Pâté, and Smoked Trout "Pâté".

winePairing.pairingText: Bordeaux, Champagne, and White Burgundy are great choices for French. French wine is just as diverse as French food, but you rarely go wrong with champagne. If your meal calls for a white wine, you might also try a white burgundy. For a red, try a red bordeaux blend. The Chateau Crusquet Sabourin Grande Reserve Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux with a 4.3 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 16 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Chateau Crusquet Sabourin Grande Reserve Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux
productMatches.description:
Deep ruby-purple in color, the nose opens to a fantastic display of black raspberry and warm plum fruitiness, with accents of savory leather, tobacco leaf, allspice, cedar, and crushed violet. The palate is broad with black fruit character that melds seamlessly into lingering spice box and fresh herbal hints. Long and well-constructed, this is a great bottle of Bordeaux for early drinking. 
Blend: 80% Merlot, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon

instructions: Flake fish into large pieces and transfer to a large bowl. Add cottage cheese, onions, creme fraiche, and olive oil; season with salt. Mix until just combined. Serve with grilled bread.

steps.step: Flake fish into large pieces and transfer to a large bowl.
Add cottage cheese, onions, creme fraiche, and olive oil; season with salt.
